main event: Bright oval-shaped lights were observed by multiple pilots at 2250 hours on 16 July 1952 over North Korea, moving at tremendous speed.
interesting points: Sightings were reported simultaneously by four different pilots over a wide area., The lights were described as white and maneuvering rapidly., The object was initially reported as a meteor in a separate incident., The exact length of observation was not reported., The report was approved by a Brigadier General in the USAF.
sighted object: bright oval-shaped lights in the sky
witness description: four sight pilots from the 1st Marine Air Wing
